attributes.comment:
The fee increase should be supported and any disapproval is driven by ulterior
motives, such as attorneys who worry the exorbitant fees they charge might be
affected.

Some argue backlog elimination is merely a front as backlog still exists. Well that
is because immigrants-more illegal than legal-keep flowing in so new backlog is
created before old one is eliminated. USCIS has been doing a great job.

The fee will be at most $1,000. It is not inability to pay either as immigrants
happily pay their attorney anywhere between $5000 and $15,000 for simple green
card cases and tens of thousands for deportation cases. Then why are
they "unable" to pay the government an appropriate amount? Or are they
unwilling? Then they should not be seeking immigration benefits in this country.

Most importantly, it is unfair that taxpayers should pay for the benefits somebody
else is seeking; we have to do so in enough areas.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
